Chapter Twenty-Two: Concerning the Knowledge of the Station of Stations and the Ordering of All Cosmic Sciences

Wondrous are the sayings of the elevated souls,
Indeed, the stations are flowing within the stations.

How is the ascent from the lowest point to the heights,
Except by the subjugation of the Transcendent Presence (الحضرة المتعالية)?

So the science of analysis (التحليل) in its ascent,
Is toward the subtleties (اللطائف) and the elevated matters.

And the science of synthesis (التركيب) upon its return,
Is with the light of Being (الوجود) toward the darkness of the abyss.

### [Ordering and Enumeration of Sciences]

Know, may Allah support you, that since the Knowledge attributed to Allah does not accept multiplicity (الكثرة) nor ordering—for it is neither acquired nor derived, but His Knowledge is the very Essence (الذات) of Himself, like all the Attributes (الصفات) attributed to Him and the Names (الأسماء) by which He is named—the sciences of what is other than Allah must be ordered and enumerated. Whether they are sciences of divine gift (وهب) or sciences of acquisition (كسب), they are not devoid of this ordering which we shall mention: first, the science of the simple (المفرد), then the science of composition (التركيب), then the science of the composite (المركب). There is no fourth category for them. If a thing is among the simples that do not accept composition, its knowledge is simple, and likewise for what remains. For every known thing must necessarily be simple or composite, and the composite necessarily requires the precedence of the science of composition, and only then does the science of the composite exist.

### [For the Descender to the Nineteen]

Now that you have learned the ordering of all cosmic sciences, let us clarify for you the enumeration of the stations (منازل) within this Station (منزل). They are numerous and cannot be counted. We shall limit ourselves to those related specifically to our Law (شرع) and by which it is distinguished, not the stations that are shared between us and others from the sciences of various religions and sects. Their total is nineteen fundamental levels (مراتب أمهات). Some of these branch out into sub-stations, and some do not. So let us mention the names of these levels and assign them the name 'Stations,' for thus we were introduced to them in the Divine Presence (الحضرة الإلهية), and propriety is paramount. Let us mention the titles of these Stations and the descriptions of their masters (أرباب) and their spiritual poles (أقطاب) who have realized them, and their spiritual states (أحوال), and the description corresponding to each of these states. Then, after that, God willing, we shall mention each category of these nineteen and mention some of the fundamental sub-stations that it encompasses, but not the individual stations themselves. For there is a Station that encompasses more than a hundred stations of signs and indications (دلالات) pointing to manifest lights, and it encompasses thousands, or fewer, of stations of ultimate goals containing hidden secrets and manifest properties. Then we shall follow what we have mentioned with the corresponding number of these Stations from the existent things (الموجودات), both ancient and recent. Then we shall mention what relates to some of the meanings of this Station, by way of approximation and abbreviation, God Almighty willing.

### «Mention of Their Titles and the Descriptions of Their Poles»

Among these are the Stations of Praise (الثناء) and Commendation (المدح), which belong to the masters of unveilings (الكشوفات) and spiritual conquest (الفتح). And the Stations of Symbols (الرموز) and Riddles (الألغاز) for the people of Reality (الحقيقة) and Metaphor (المجاز). And the Stations of Supplication (الدعاء) for the people of allusions (الإشارات) and distance. And the Stations of Acts (الأفعال) for the people of spiritual states (الأحوال) and connection (الاتصال). And the Stations of Beginning (الابتداء) for the people of passing thoughts (الهواجس) and subtle indications (الإيماء). And the Stations of Transcendence (التنزيه) for the people of orientation in debates and inference (الاستنباط). And the Stations of Nearness (التقريب) for the God-aspiring strangers (الغرباء المتألهين). And the Stations of Expectation (التوقع) for the veiled ones, due to the veils of Majesty (السبحات). And the Stations of Blessings (البركات) for the people of movement. And the Stations of Oaths (الأقسام) for the people of governance among the spiritual beings (الروحانيين). And the Stations of Aeon (الدهر) for the people of spiritual taste (الذوق). And the Stations of I-ness (الإنية) for the people of witnessing (المشاهدة) with the eyes. And the Stations of Lām-Alif (اللام والألف) for the intertwining (الالتفاف) resulting from assuming the Divine characteristics (الأخلاق الإلهية), and for the people of the secret that is not unveiled. And the Stations of Confirmation (التقرير) for the people of knowledge of natural and spiritual alchemy. And the Stations of Annihilation of the Cosmoses (فناء الأكوان) for the cherished, secluded ones. And the Stations of Intimacy (الألفة) for the people of security among the dwellers of the chambers. And the Stations of Threat (الوعيد) for those clinging to the pillar of the Most Glorious Throne. And the Stations of Inquiry (الاستخبار) for the people of obscure secrets. And the Stations of Command (الأمر) for those who realize the realities of His secret within themselves.

As for their descriptions: The people of Commendation possess splendor. The people of Symbols possess salvation from objection. As for the God-aspiring ones, they possess bewilderment through characterization. As for the people of states and connection, they attain the very essence (العين). As for the people of allusion, they experience confusion when conveying the message. As for the people of inference, they experience error and correctness, and they are not infallible. As for the strangers, they possess brokenness. As for the veiled ones, they possess fear. As for the people of movement, they witness the causes (الأسباب). And the governors possess contemplation. And the established ones possess limits. And the people of witnessing possess denial. And the people of concealment possess safety. And the people of knowledge possess judgment over the known thing. And the people of veiling await its removal. And the people of security are in the place of fear of divine cunning (المكر). And the people of standing possess sitting/settling. And the people of inspiration (الإلهام) possess control. And the people of realization (التحقيق) possess three garments: the garment of faith (إيمان), disbelief (كفر), and hypocrisy (نفاق).

### [The States of the Masters of the Descender]

As for the mention of their states, know that God Almighty has prepared the Stations for the descender, smoothed the strongholds for the rational one, folded the stages for the traveler, elevated the landmarks for the knower, detailed the portions for the divider, prepared the destroyers for the destroyer, clarified the protectors for the protected one, raised the foundations for the settled one, ordered the observatories for the observer, subjugated the mounts for the rider, brought near the paths for the one who goes, inscribed the praises for the praiser, facilitated the goals for the seeker, originated the gnoses (المعارف) for the gnostic (العارف), established the standpoints for the one who stands, made the paths rugged for the traveler (السالك), specified the rites for the devotee (الناسك), silenced the witnessed things for the witness, and guarded the stars for the sleeper.

### «Mention of the Descriptions of Their States»

For He, glory be to Him, made the descender a determiner, the rational one a contemplator, the traveler one who prepares himself, the knower a witnesser, the divider one who endures hardship, the destroyer one who strives, the protected one a helper, the settled one a gnostic, the observer one who stands firm, the rider one who is carried, the one who goes one who is caused, the praiser one who is questioned, the seeker one who is accepted, the gnostic one who is blessed, the one who stands firm one who is bewildered, the traveler one who is rejected, the devotee one who is distanced, the witness one who is established, and the sleeper one who submits.

Thus, we have mentioned the descriptions of these nineteen categories in their states. So let us mention what each category encompasses of the fundamental stations. Every station among these fundamentals encompasses four categories of stations: The first category is called the Stations of Indications (الدلالات), the second is called the Stations of Limits (الحدود), the third is called the Stations of Properties (الخواص), and the fourth is called the Stations of Secrets (الأسرار). They are too numerous to count. So let us limit ourselves to the nineteen and mention the numbers of the fundamentals they contain. This is the first of them:

### [The Station of Commendation]

The Station of Commendation (المدح) has the Station of Spiritual Conquest (الفتح)—the conquest of the two secrets—and the Station of the First Keys, and we have a section concerning it which we named *The Keys of the Unseen* (مفاتيح الغيوب). And the Station of Wonders. And the Station of Subjugation of the Spirits of the Isthmus (الأرواح البرزخية). And the Station of the Celestial Spirits. And concerning some of its meanings, we have the following verses:

The Stations of Commendation and Glory,
Stations that have no end.
Seek not commendation in elevation,
The praises of the folk are in the dust.
He whose soul thirsts through striving (جهاد),
Drinks from the sweetest waters.

We say that the commendation of the servant is not that he describes himself with the attributes of his Master, for that is ill-manners. But the Master may describe Himself with the attributes of His servant out of humility. For the Master has the right to descend, because He is not judged. So His descent to the attributes of His servant is a favor from Him upon His servant, so that He may comfort him. For the Majesty of the Master is too great in the heart of the servant to point to Him, were it not for His descent to him. And the servant does not have the right to describe himself with the attributes of his Master, neither in His Presence nor among his brethren, the servants, even if he governs them, just as he, peace be upon him, said: "I am the Master of the children of Adam, and no boast." And He Almighty said: <<تِلْكَ الدَّارُ الْآخِرَةُ نَجْعَلُها>> (That is the Home of the Hereafter, We grant it)—meaning, We make them possess it as a possession—<<لِلَّذِينَ لا يُرِيدُونَ عُلُوًّا في الْأَرْضِ>> (for those who desire neither high status in the land). For Allah has made the earth submissive, and the servant is the submissive one, and submission does not necessitate high status. So whoever exceeds his measure perishes. It is said: No man perished who knew his measure. And his saying, "Stations that have no end," means that the servant has no end in his servitude (عبودية) that he reaches and then returns as a Lord, just as the Lord has no limit that He reaches and then returns as a servant. So the Lord is Lord eternally, and the servant is servant eternally. That is why he said, "The praises of the folk are in the dust," and the servant is more submissive than the surface of the earth. And he said, "No one knows the pleasure of water except the thirsty one," meaning, no one knows the pleasure of being characterized by servitude except he who has tasted the pains when characterized by Lordship and the need of creation for him.

Like Solomon (سليمان), when he requested that Allah place the provision of the servants physically in his hands. All the provisions that were present at that time were brought, and then a creature from the creatures of the sea emerged and requested its sustenance. He said to it: "Take from this the measure of your sustenance for every day." So it ate it until it finished the last of it. Then it said: "Give me more, for you have not fulfilled my provision. For Allah gives me ten times this amount every day, and there are creatures greater than me and with more provision." So Solomon, peace be upon him, repented to his Lord and knew that what belongs to the Creator Almighty is not within the capacity of the created being. For he had requested from Allah a dominion that should not belong to anyone after him. He withdrew his request when he saw that. And the creatures gathered around him, seeking their provisions from all directions, so he was distressed by that. But when Allah accepted his request and relieved him, he found a pleasure in that which cannot be measured.

(The Station of Symbols)

Know, may Allah grant you success, that although this is one Station, it contains sub-stations. Among them is the Station of Absolute Unity (الوحدانية). And the Station of the First Intellect (العقل الأولي) and the Greatest Throne (العرش الأعظم). And the Echo, and the coming of the scholars to the Throne. And the science of representation. And the Station of Hearts (القلوب) and the Veil (الحجاب). And the Station of the Comprehending Establishment and the Pervasive Divinity. And the derivation of the soothsayers and the Aeon (الدهر). And the Stations that have no permanence, and in which no one has permanence. And the Station of the Isthmuses (البرازخ), Divinity, Increase, and Jealousy. And the Station of Loss and Finding. And the Station of Removal of Doubts, Generosity, and the Hidden Treasure. And the Station of Subjugation and Sinking. And the Station of the Vast Earth. When I entered this Station while I was in Tunis, a cry escaped me, of which I had no knowledge that it had occurred, except that everyone who heard it fell down unconscious. And those women of the neighbors who were looking down upon us from the roof of the house fainted, and some of them fell from the roofs into the courtyard, despite the height, and no harm befell them. I was the first to regain consciousness, and we were praying behind an Imam. I saw no one except those who were thunderstruck. After a while they recovered, and I said: "What is the matter with you?" They said: "What is the matter with you? You uttered a cry that caused what you see in the congregation." I said: "By God, I have no knowledge that I cried out." And the Station of Strange Signs and Divine Wisdoms. And the Station of Readiness, Adornment, and the Command (الأمر) by which Allah holds the celestial spheres. And the Station of Remembrance and Negation. And concerning these Stations, I said:

The Stations of the Cosmos in Existence (الوجود),
Stations, all of them are symbols (رموز).
Stations wherein for the intellects,
All the indications are metaphorical.
When the seekers came intending
To attain something, that is what they were permitted.
O servants of the entity, take possession
Of that which drove you, and pass on.

The symbol and the riddle is speech whose apparent meaning gives what its speaker did not intend. And likewise, the station of the world in Existence (الوجود): Allah did not bring it into existence for its own sake, but Allah brought it into existence for His own sake. So the world occupied itself with what it was not created for, thus opposing the intention of its Originator. For this reason, a group of gnostic scholars—who are in a better state than those below them—say that Allah brought us into existence for ourselves. But the realized one (المحقق) and the servant do not say that; rather, he says: He brought us into existence for Him, not out of any need from Him for me. For we are the riddle of my Lord and His symbol. And whoever knows the poetry of riddles knows what we intended. As for his saying, "When the seekers came intending to attain something, that is what they were permitted," this refers to metaphors. He means: whoever seeks Allah for the sake of a matter, he is for what he sought, and he will attain nothing else from Him. And his saying, "O servants of the entity," means: whoever worships Allah for the sake of something, that thing is his object of worship and his lord, and Allah is innocent of him, and he belongs to what he worshipped. And his saying, "Take possession," means: take what you came for, i.e., because of it, and "pass on," means: leave us, for you did not come to us nor for our sake.

(The Station of Supplication)

This Station contains sub-stations. Among them is the Station of Intimacy with the similar. And the Station of Nourishment. And the Station of Mecca, Ta’if, and the Veils. And the Station of the Chambers and Trial. And the Station of Gathering, Separation, and Withholding. And the Station of the Growing Things and Sanctification. And concerning this Station, I said:

For the bewildered one of the Merciful, there are stations in you,
So answer the call of the Real willingly, O so-and-so.
The sent ones raise their hands to you,
Hoping for bounty, so the asker is not disappointed.
You are the one whose virtue the proof declared,
And we have witnesses and indications concerning it.
Were it not for your specialization in the Reality (الحقيقة),
The stations would not have shone with your supreme descent to them.

He says that the call of the Real to His servants is only the tongue of the sent ones, seeking a Name from His Names. And that servant at that time is under their authority. And the sent ones are the subtleties of creation, raising their hands to the one who holds them among the Names, so that He may bestow it upon the one who seeks it among the Names. And the one who is always asked is only the one who has dominion over the Names, like the All-Knowing, who has precedence over the All-Aware, the Reckoner, the Enumerator, and the Favorer. For this reason, he said: "You are the one whose virtue the proof declared." And the Reality by which he is specialized is his encompassing of what is below him in rank among the Divine Names. Since the Powerful is lower in rank than the Willing, and the Knowing is higher in rank than the Willing, and the Living is above all. So the stations that are under the encompassment of the Comprehensive Name boast of His descent to them in response to their request.

(The Station of Acts)

And it encompasses sub-stations. Among them is the Station of Grace and Inspiration (الإلهام). And the Station of the Spiritual Night Journey. And the Station of Subtlety. And the Station of Destruction. And concerning these Stations, I say:

For the Stations of Acts (الأفعال) there is a flashing lightning,
And its winds drive the clouds with tempests.
And its arrows are piercing in the worlds,
And its swords are decisive among the existent things.
It cast its command toward the Realized Glory,
So the eye sees, but the attainment is distant.

People regarding the acts of the servants are of two divisions: one group sees the acts as originating from the servants, and another group sees the acts as originating from Allah. And for each group, along with their belief, something like the flashing lightning appears in that matter, which momentarily grants a certain attribution of that act to the one from whom they negated it. And each group has a cloud that intervenes between it and the attribution of the act to the one from whom they negated it. And his saying concerning its winds that they are severe means that the causes (الأسباب) and proofs established for each group regarding the attribution of the acts to the one they attribute them to are strong, when viewed from their perspective. And he described its arrows as piercing the souls of those who hold that belief, and likewise its swords are decisive among them. And his saying that it "cast its command toward the Glory" means that it sought refuge in a protective sanctuary that prevents the opponent from affecting it, so everyone remains upon what is the Will of Allah concerning him. He Almighty said: <<زَيَّنَّا لِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ عَمَلَهُمْ>> (We have made fair-seeming to every nation their deeds). And his saying, "So the eye sees," means that the senses witness the act belonging to the servant, and the human finds that within himself due to the choice he possesses in it. And his saying, "but the attainment is distant," means that its attribution to what is other than what the sense and the soul grant is far from attainment, except that there must be a flashing lightning in it that grants an attribution of that act to the one from whom it was negated, which one cannot deny.

(The Station of Beginning)

And it encompasses sub-stations. Among them is the Station of Harshness and the Veils of Majesty. And the Station of Descents (التنزلات) and the knowledge of Divine Unity (التوحيد الإلهي). And the Station of Mercy/Compassion. And the Station of the Real (الحق) and Terror. And concerning this Station, I say:

For the Beginning there are witnesses and indications,
And for it, when the riders dismount, there are stations.
Its ruling encompasses the very essence of contingent events,
And God, the Generous, the Doer, sustains it.
There is no kinship between it and its God,
Except for the dependence and the resultant Existence (الوجود).
Do not listen to the saying of an ignorant one,
That the structure of Existence is built upon realities and falsehoods.
The structure of Existence is manifest realities,
And what is other than Existence is the impossible falsehood.

He says that the beginning of the cosmoses (الأكوان) has witnesses within them that they did not exist for themselves, and then they came to be. And "for it"—the pronoun refers to the Beginning—"when the riders dismount," means: if you trace it back to where it came from, you find it originating from the one who brought it into existence. And for that reason, it possesses Subsistence (البقاء). He Almighty said: <<وَمَا عِنْدَ اللَّهِ بَاقٍ>> (And what is with Allah remains). So when you dismount at His presence, you know its station from Him, which it held when it did not exist for itself. And that is the Station of Divine Primordiality in His saying: He is the First. And from this Primordiality issued the beginning of the cosmos. And from Him all contingent events derive their sustenance, and He is the ruler over them, and they proceed according to His ruling. And the negation of kinship from it, for the Primordiality of the Real sustains the primordiality of the servant. And the primordiality of the cosmos has no sustenance for anything. So there is no kinship except Providence, no cause except the Ruling, and no time except Eternity (الأزل). This is the doctrine of the folk. And what remains that does not fall under the enumeration of these three is blindness and confusion. Thus declared the author of *Maḥāsin al-Majālis*. And the saying of whoever said that the structure of Existence is built upon realities and falsehoods is not correct. For falsehood is non-existence, and this is correct. For derived Existence is in the category of non-existence. And the Real Existence is that whose existence is for itself. And every non-existence that came to exist, only existed from an existence that was described by it for another, not for itself. And what was derived is Existence for its essence. As for the impossible falsehood, it is that which has no existence, neither for itself nor from another.

(The Station of Transcendence)

This Station encompasses sub-stations. Among them is the Station of Gratitude. And the Station of Distress. And the Station of Resurrection. And the Station of Victory and Gathering. And the Station of Profit, Loss, and Transformations. And concerning this, we have:

For the Stations of Transcendence (التنزيه) and Sanctification,
There is a spoken secret whose ruling is intelligible.
A knowledge whose ruling returns to the one who transcends,
A paradise of holiness, a garden watered by dew.
So the one who transcends the Manifest Real permits
What he says, and his aim is misguidance.

He says: The one who truly transcends is he who is pure for himself. And one only performs transcendence for the one upon whom what is transcended from is permissible, and that is the created being. For this reason, the transcendence returns to the one who performs transcendence. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "They are only your deeds returned to you." So whoever’s deed is transcendence, his transcendence returns to him, and his locus becomes transcendent from having a belief concerning the Real that is inappropriate for Him. And from this perspective, whoever said "Glory be to me" said it out of magnification of God Almighty’s Majesty (جلال). And for this reason, he said, "a garden watered by dew," which is the descent of transcendence to the locus of the servant who transcends his Creator. And Allah speaks the Truth, and He guides to the way.

(The Station of Nearness)

This Station encompasses two sub-stations: the Station of Breaking the Norms and the Station of the Oneness of 'Be!' (كن). Concerning it, I recited:

For the Stations of Nearness (التقريب) there is a known condition,
And they have dominion over the essence of the entity.
And when the condition of the Resurrection comes and its Compeller is established,
Existence submits and serves.
Far be it! Souls do not harvest their fruits,
Except those that acted, and you are embodied.

He says that Nearness is among the attributes of contingent things because they accept nearness and its opposite. And the Real is the Near, even though He has described Himself as drawing near. And the verbal noun from it is *taqrīb* (bringing near) and *taqarrub* (drawing near). And when he said, "a known condition," this is the acceptance of influence/effect. He said: And the matter is not known or unveiled generally except in the Hereafter. And he said: And souls have no harvest except what they planted in their worldly life, whether good or evil. So they have nearness from their deeds. <<فَمَنْ يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُ وَمَنْ يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُ>> (So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it, and whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it).

(The Station of Expectation)

This Station also encompasses two sub-stations: the Station of the Divine Path and the Station of Hearing. Concerning it, I composed:

Stations for Expectation have appeared manifest,
And their clusters are near to the hand of the one brought near.
So pluck their fruits from the branches of nearness,
Do not pluck from the ordinary branches.
Do not depart from your moderation, and adhere
To the middle of the path, and you will see the realities manifest.

He says that what a human expects has already appeared, because he does not expect anything unless it has an appearance with him in his inner being. It has already emerged from the unseen that he deserves into the inner being of the one who expects it. Then he expects its appearance in the world of witnessing (عالم الشهادة), so it becomes closer to attainment. And that is His saying: <<قُطُوفُها دَانِيَةٌ>> (Its clusters are near), meaning, close to the hand of the plucker. He says: Guard the path of moderation, do not deviate from it. And moderation here is your adherence to your reality, not departing from it, as the arrogant ones departed. And whoever is an isthmus (برزخ) between the two extremes has the ability to look down upon both of them. But if he inclines toward one of them, he is veiled from the other.

(The Station of Blessings)

It also encompasses two sub-stations: the Station of Gathering and Separation, and the Station of Isthmus-like Contention, which is the Station of Dominion and Subjugation. Concerning it, I said:

For the Stations of Blessings (البركات) there is a light that shines,
And for it, there is expectation in the seeds of hearts.
In them is increase for every seeker of witnessing,
And they aspire toward the very soul of Existence (الوجود).
When the secret of the seeker of wisdom is realized
By the realities of the Blessings, the ascent is strengthened.
So praise be to Allah, in whose cosmos
His entities (أعيان) are witnessed and heard.

Blessings are increase, and they are among the results of gratitude. And the Real Almighty did not name Himself with the Name the Grateful and the Most Grateful except so that we may increase in the deed He legislated for us to perform, just as the Real increases the favors through our gratitude. So every soul aspires to increase. He says: And when the seeker of wisdom realizes the increase, he isolates himself with matters, striving that no one shares them with him, so that the increase may be of that specific kind. And the state of the master of this station is the contemplation of the state he seeks.

(The Station of Oaths and Vows)

This Station encompasses sub-stations. Among them is the Station of the Comprehending Merciful Realities. And the Station of Spiritual Portions. And the Station of Inscriptions. And the Station of the Falling Places of Light. And the Station of the Poets. And the Station of Spiritual Levels. And the Station of the Universal Soul (النفس الكلية). And the Station of the Pole (القطب). And the Station of the Bursting Forth of Lights upon the World of the Unseen (عالم الغيب). And the Station of the Levels of the Rational Soul. And the Station of the Difference of Paths. And the Station of Affection. And the Station of the Sciences of Inspiration. And the Station of the Animal Souls. And the Station of the Middle Prayer. And concerning this, I said:

The Stations of Oaths are in the breadth,
Their rulings are in the world of the earth.
They run by the spheres of good fortune upon
Him who adheres to the Sunna and the Obligation.
And their knowledge is restricted to their essence,
And their ruling is in the length and the breadth.

He says: The oath is the result of suspicion. And the Real deals with creation from the perspective of what they are, not from the perspective of what He is. For this reason, the Real Almighty did not swear by the angels, because they are not from the world of suspicion. And it is not for a created being to swear by a created being, and this is our doctrine. And if he swears by a created being according to us, he is disobedient, and there is no expiation upon him if he breaks the oath; he must only repent for what he fell into. The Real only swore by Himself when He swore by mentioning the created things. And the omission of the Name indicates that, by the manifestation of the Name in places in the Glorious Book, such as His saying: <<فَوَرَبِّ السَّماءِ والْأَرْضِ>> (So by the Lord of the heaven and earth) ... <<بِرَبِّ الْمَشارِقِ والْمَغارِبِ>> (By the Lord of the Easts and the Wests). So that was a sign in the places where the Name was not explicitly mentioned, that it was concealed there for a matter He, glory be to Him, intended in that context. This is known by whomever the Real has made it known to, whether a prophet or an inspired saint. For the oath is proof of the magnification of the one sworn by. And there is no doubt that in the oath, mention is made of those who see and those who do not see. So this includes the elevated and the lowly, the one pleased with and the one angered at, the beloved and the hated, the believer and the disbeliever, the existent and the non-existent. And no one knows the Stations of Oaths except he who knows the World of the Unseen. So it is highly probable that the Divine Name is implied here. And we have informed you that the World of the Unseen is the length, and the World of Witnessing is the breadth.

(The Station of I-ness)

And it encompasses sub-stations. Among them is the Station of Solomon, peace be upon him, distinct from other prophets. And the Station of Complete Veiling. And the Station of the Difference of Created Things. And the Station of the Spirit (الروح). And the Station of Sciences. Concerning it, I say:

A holy I-ness (إنية) that is witnessed,
For its Existence, there are stations among men.
It annihilates the entity when it manifests as a form,
In a chapter whose signs differ in excellence.
And it shows you its Existence within you by its attributes,
Behind the shadows, its Existence encompasses you.

He says that the Divine Reality, meaningful by the attributes of Transcendence, when witnessed, annihilates every essence (عين) other than itself, even if its witnessing differs in excellence within the single person according to his states, and among different persons due to the difference in their states. This is due to what the Reality grants: that the witness among us witnesses nothing but himself, just as It witnesses nothing of us but Itself. So every reality is a mirror for the other. The believer is the mirror of his brother. <<لَيْسَ كَمِثْلِهِ شَيْءٌ>> (There is nothing like unto Him).

(The Station of Aeons)

This Station is upon sub-stations. Among them is the Station of Precedence. And the Station of Might. And the Station of the Spiritualities of the Spheres. And the Station of the Divine Command. And the Station of Birth. And the Station of Balance. And the Station of Glad Tidings of the Encounter. Concerning it, I say:

And among the stations are those that are determined,
Like Time (الزمان), for it is imagined.
The revolving spheres indicated it by their cycles,
And for it is disposal and the Greatest Station.

He says: Since Eternity (الأزل) was an imagined matter concerning the Real, Time was also an imagined matter concerning the Real, meaning, an imagined duration cut by the movements of the spheres. For Eternity is like Time for creation, so understand.

(The Station of Lām-Alif)

This is the Station of Intertwining, and agreement prevails over difference. He Almighty said: <<وَالْتَفَّتِ السَّاقُ بِالسَّاقِ إِلَى رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ الْمَسَاقُ>> (And the leg is intertwined with the leg, to your Lord on that Day will be the driving). And it contains sub-stations. Among them is the Station of the Meeting of the Two Seas and the Gathering of the Two Commands. And the Station of Muhammadan Honor which is beside the Self-Sufficient Station. Concerning it, I say:

The Stations of the Lām in realization (التحقيق) and the Alif,
At the encounter, is the separation of their state of union.
They are the highest proof for whoever said, "Indeed, I am
The secret of Existence (الوجود) and I am its essence," so understand.
Excellent are the two proofs, for they indicate by their state,
Not like the one who indicates by sayings, and then ceases.

He says: Even if the Lām is connected to the Alif and is contracted, becoming a single essence, and this is manifest in the paired letters in the twenty-eighth station, between the Wāw and the Yā’, which possess soundness and defect. Because of the defect in the Alif and the soundness in the Lām, the correspondence occurred between it and these two letters. So the sound part of it follows the letter of soundness, and the defective part of it follows the letter of defect. So His hands are outstretched with Mercy (الرحمة) and contracted with its opposite. And Lām-Alif has no form in the arrangement of the simple letters, rather it is unseen within them, and its rank remains as it is, between the Wāw and the Yā’. And the Zāy, the Ḥā’, and the dry Ṭā’ have acted as substitutes in its place. So in its unseen aspect, it has the seventh, eighth, and ninth ranks. So it has the station of the moon between the full moon and the crescent. So the rank of the Isthmus (البرزخية) constantly accompanies it in its absence and its manifestation. So it is the twenty-fourth, since it had the seven by the Zāy, the eight by the Ḥā’, and the nine by the Ṭā’, and the day is twenty-four hours. So in whichever hour you act by it, your deed will succeed according to the balance of action by convention, because it is in the letters of calculation, not in the letters of nature. Because it has nothing in the letters of nature except the Lām, which is a letter of the tongue, an isthmus between the throat and the lips. And the Alif is not among the letters of nature. So it only substituted for one letter, which is the Lām, from which the Alif is generated when its vowel is fully pronounced. If it is not fully pronounced, the Hamza appears. For this reason, some scholars made the Alif half a letter and the Hamza half a letter in conventional calculation, not in natural pronunciation. Then we return and say: If the Lām is contracted with the Alif, as we said, and they become a single essence, then its two thighs indicate that they are two. Then the expression by its name indicates that it is two. So it is a composite name of two names for two essences. One essence is the Lām, and the other is the Alif. But when they appeared in the form as a single shape, the observer did not distinguish between them, and it was not clear to him which of the two thighs was the Lām so that the other might be the Alif. So the scribes differed concerning it. Some considered the pronunciation, and others considered what the drawer begins with, making it first. They agreed on the precedence of the Lām over the Alif, because the Alif here is undoubtedly generated from the Lām. And likewise, the Hamza follows the Lām, as in His saying: <<لَأَنْتُمْ أَشَدُّ رَهْبَةً>> (You are certainly a greater fear) and its likes. And this letter, meaning Lām-Alif, is the letter of ambiguity in the Acts (الأفعال). So the apparent act performed by the created being was not purified as to whom it belongs. If you say it is for Allah, you speak truly, and if you say it is for the created being, you speak truly. Were it not for that, the religious obligation and the attribution of the deed from Allah to the servant would not be valid. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, says: "They are only your deeds returned to you." And Allah says: <<وَمَا يَفْعَلُوا مِنْ خَيْرٍ فَلَنْ يُكْفَرُوهُ>> (And whatever good they do, they will never be denied it) and <<اعْمَلُوا مَا شِئْتُمْ إِنَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ>> (Do what you will; indeed, He is Seeing of what you do). And Allah speaks the Truth. So likewise, whichever of the two thighs you make the Lām or the Alif, you speak truly, even if the practice differs in placing the shape among the scholars of it, for the sake of realizing the form. And whoever indicates that the act belongs to one of the two thighs without the other, that is not correct, and its proponent is cut off and does not remain firm. And another person among the people of that concern contradicts him in that and indicates, in his claim, and the saying with him is like the saying with his opponent. And the matter conflicts and becomes difficult, except for the one whose insight Allah has illuminated and guided to the straight path.

(The Station of Confirmation)

And it encompasses sub-stations. Among them is the Station of Enumeration of Blessings. And the Station of Removal of Harm. And the Station of Absolute Association (الشرك المطلق). Concerning that, I say:

The stations were confirmed by stillness,
And manifestation (الظهور) outweighed concealment (الكمون).
And they indicated, by direct sight, springs
Gushing forth from flowing water.
And they indicated, by lightning flashes, rain clouds
Which, when they flash, point to the Manifest Light.

Know, may Allah support you, that he says permanence confirms the stations. So whoever is permanent and manifests to every essence upon its reality. Do you not see what the speed of movement grants you of resemblance? So the observer judges the thing contrary to what that thing truly is. He says concerning the fire in the ember or the tip of the wick, if it moves quickly horizontally, that it is an elongated line. Or he spins it quickly and sees a circle of fire in the air. And the reason for that is the lack of permanence. And when the stations are permanent, they indicate the Divine sciences they contain.

(The Station of Witnessing)

And it is a single station: the Station of the Annihilation of the Cosmos (فناء الكون). In it, whoever did not exist is annihilated, and whoever has always existed remains. Concerning it, I say:

In the Annihilation of the Cosmos is a station,
Whose spirit descends within us.
Indeed, it is my Night of Power,
It has neither light nor shadow.
It is the pure essence of Light,
There is no movement away from it.
So I am truly the Imam,
A king in the first breast/origin.
With him is the key to my command,
So he appoints you and dismisses you.
My Samhari spears are long,
I am not the unarmed Simāk (star).
So the Real Station (المقام الحق) in you
Is permanent and does not change.
And He is the Subduer from Him,
And He is the Most Just Imam.
He is not the represented light,
But more perfect than the wild cow (or crystal).
And I am certainly from Him,
In the place of the most excellent secret.
So by the essence of the Essence (عين العين) I ascend,
And by the command of the Command (أمر الأمر) I descend.

He says: The state of annihilation has neither light nor shadow, like the Night of Power. Then he said: And that is the true light and the true shadow. For it is the origin that has no opposite. And lights are opposed by darknesses, but this is opposed by nothing. And his saying, "I am the Imam," means his witnessing of the Real from the specific aspect that is from Him to me, which is the first breast/origin. And from this station occurs the detailing, the multiplicity (الكثرة), and the number in the forms. And he made the Samhari spears a metaphor for the influence of the Self-Subsisting (القيومية) in the world. And it possesses permanence, and that is why he said, "does not change." And for Him is subjugation and justice, which does not accept anthropomorphism. So by witnessing the Essence (الذات) I ascend, and by the Divine Command (الأمر الإلهي) I descend as an Imam in the world.

(The Station of Intimacy)

It is a single station, and concerning it, I say:

The Stations of Intimacy (الألفة) are familiar,
And by this description they are known.
So say to him who celebrates his wedding therein: "Stay,"
For it is surrounded by security (الأمن).
And it is dependent upon the two,
And diverted from the torment of the single one.

This is the Station of weddings, joy, and happiness. And it is among what Allah bestowed upon His Prophet Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, when He said: <<لَوْ أَنْفَقْتَ مَا فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا مَا أَلَّفْتَ بَيْنَ قُلُوبِهِمْ>> (Had you spent all that is in the earth, you could not have reconciled their hearts)—meaning, against you—<<وَلَكِنَّ اللَّهَ أَلَّفَ بَيْنَهُمْ>> (but Allah reconciled them)—meaning, upon your affection, your response, and your confirmation.

(The Station of Inquiry)

And it encompasses sub-stations. Among them is the Station of Spiritual Contention. And the Station of the adornment of the fortunate, how it appears upon the wretched, and vice versa. And the Station of the cosmos before the human. Concerning it, I say:

If I inquire about the beloveds of my heart,
They refer me to the inquiry of my utterance.
Their stations are only by your utterance,
O my misfortune for that, and my ill luck!
I admonished the soul not to look at them,
But it did not turn its thought to my admonition.
I cast them out, hoping to attain a cosmos,
But they were the very essence of my cosmos, the essence of my utterance.
And he said: And it is wondrous that I yearn for them,
And ask about them those whom I see, while they are with me.
And my eye watches for them while they are in its blackness,
And my heart longs for them while they are between my ribs.

He says: They are on my tongue when I ask about them, and in the blackness of my eye when I look at them, and in my heart when I think of them and long for them. So they are with me in every state I am in. So they are my essence, but I am not their essence, since they do not possess of me what I possess of them.

(The Station of Threat)

It is a single station, containing injustice and adherence to the cosmos. Concerning it, I said:

Indeed, the Threat (الوعيد) is two stations, for him
Who abandoned the spiritual journey (السلوك) upon the most upright path.
But when his existence is realized by perfection,
And he walks according to the ruling of the primordial height,
They return as bliss for him, so his bliss
Is in the Fire, and it is the bliss of every honored one.

A spiritual station, which is the torment of the souls, and a physical station, which is the sensible torment. And it only occurs for him who deviates from the legislated path, outwardly and inwardly. But if he is granted success in uprightness, and Providence preceded for him, he is protected from that, and he finds bliss in the fire of striving (المجاهدة) for the paradise of witnessing (المشاهدة).

(The Station of Command)

And it encompasses sub-stations. The Station of the Spirits of the Isthmus. And the Station of Teaching. And the Secret Station. And the Station of the Cause. And the Station of Amulets. And the Station of the Pole and the Two Imams. Concerning it, we have:

The Stations of Command (الأمر)—it is the I-ness of the Essence (إنية الذات),
By which my joys and pleasures are attained.
Would that I remain standing in them throughout my life,
And not depart until the time of the Encounter.
The coolness of the eye for the Chosen One was his,
When he manifested in the origin of the intimate discourse (المناجاة).

The Divine Command is from the Attribute of Speech (الكلام). And it is blocked off from the saints (الأولياء) from the perspective of legislation. And there is no obligatory command in the Divine Presence unless it is legislated. So nothing remains for the saint except hearing its command when it commands the prophets. So the saint, upon hearing that, experiences a pleasure pervading his existence. But there remains for the saints the Divine intimate discourse in which there is no command, only conversation and narration. So whoever among the people of unveiling (الكشف) says that he is commanded by a Divine command in his movements and stillness that contradicts a Muhammadan legislative obligation, the matter has become ambiguous for him, even if he is truthful in what he said he heard. It is only possible if a Divine Theophany (تجلي إلهي) appeared to him in the form of his Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and his Prophet addressed him, or he was established in hearing the address of his Prophet. And that is because the Messenger conveys the command of the Real Almighty, which Allah commanded His servants with. So it is possible that he hears from the Real in a certain Presence that command which His Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, first brought to him, so he says, "The Real commanded me," but in his case, it is merely an affirmation that He has commanded. And this cause was cut off with Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him. And regarding commands from Allah other than the legislated ones, the saints have a firm footing in that. Thus, we have covered the nineteen categories of stations. So let us mention the most specific characteristics of each station, and we say:

### (Section) [Mentioning the Most Specific Characteristics of Each of the Nineteen Stations]

The most specific characteristic of the Station of Commendation is the connection of Knowledge (العلم) to what is endless. And the most specific characteristic of the Station of Symbols is the connection of Knowledge to the properties of numbers and Names (الأسماء), which are the words and letters, and in it is the science of Sympathy/Magic. And the most specific characteristic of the Station of Supplication is the sciences of allusion and adornment. And the most specific characteristic of the Station of Acts is the science of the Now. And the most specific characteristic of the Station of Beginning is the science of the Origin and the Return, and the knowledge of the primordial aspects of everything. And the most specific characteristic of Transcendence is the science of stripping off and divestiture. And the most specific characteristic of Nearness is the science of indications. And the most specific characteristic of the Station of Expectation is the science of kinship and relations. Or the most specific characteristic of the Station of Blessings is the science of causes, conditions, defects, proofs, and the Reality (الحقيقة). And the most specific characteristic of Oaths is the sciences of Magnificence. And the most specific characteristic of the Station of Aeon is the science of Eternity and the permanence of the Creator’s Existence (وجود). Or the most specific characteristic of the Station of I-ness is the science of the Essence (الذات). And the most specific characteristic of the Station of Lām-Alif is the science of the relation of the cosmos to the Originator. And the most specific characteristic of the Station of Confirmation is the science of Presence. And the most specific characteristic of the Station of Annihilation of the Cosmos is the science of the transformation of the essences (الأعيان). And the most specific characteristic of the Station of Intimacy is the science of cohesion/fusion. And the most specific characteristic of the Station of Threat is the science of the dwelling places. And the most specific characteristic of the Station of Inquiry is the knowledge of: <<لَيْسَ كَمِثْلِهِ شَيْءٌ>> (There is nothing like unto Him). And the most specific characteristic of the Station of Command is the science of servitude (العبودة).

### (Section) [Mentioning the Nineteen Divine Stations and What Corresponds to Them Among the Contingent Things]

Know that for every one of these nineteen stations, there is a category of contingent things (الممكنات). Among them is the category of angels, and they are a single category, even if their states differ. (And the science of bodies is eighteen): The spheres are eleven types, the elements are four, and the generated things are three. And they have another aspect that corresponds to them among the contingent things in the Divine Presence (الحضرة الإلهية):

1. The substance (الجوهر) for the Essence (الذات)—and this is the first.
2. The second: the accidents, and they are for the Attributes (الصفات).
3. The third: Time (الزمان), and it is for Eternity (الأزل).
4. The fourth: Space, and it is for Establishment or the descriptions.
5. The fifth: the relations for the relations.
6. The sixth: the positions for the Comprehending Reality.
7. The seventh: the quantities for the Names (الأسماء).
8. The eighth: the qualities for the Theophanies (التجليات).
9. The ninth: the influences for Generosity.
10. The tenth: the affections/passions for the manifestation in the forms of beliefs.
11. The eleventh: the specific property, and it is for the Oneness (الأحدية).
12. The twelfth: the bewilderment, and it is for the description by descent, joy, loan, and similar things.
13. The thirteenth: the life of existent things for the Living.
14. The fourteenth: Gnosis (المعرفة) for Knowledge (العلم).
15. The fifteenth: the passing thoughts for the Will.
16. The sixteenth: the sights for the Seeing.
17. The seventeenth: the hearing for the Hearing.
18. The eighteenth: the human for Perfection (الكمال).
19. The nineteenth: the lights and the darknesses for the Light (النور).

(Section on the Correspondences of the Nineteen Stations)

Their correspondences from the Quran are the isolated letters at the beginning of the Surahs, and they are fourteen letters in five levels: singular, dual, triple, quadruple, and quintuple. And their correspondences from the Fire are the nineteen guardian angels. Their correspondences in influence are the twelve constellations and the seven wandering stars. Their correspondences from the Quran are the letters of the Basmala. And their correspondences from men are the twelve Chiefs and the seven Substitutes (الأبدال). And these seven include the four Pegs (الأوتاد), the two Imams, and the one Pole (القطب). And the correspondences for these stations from the Divine Presence and from the cosmoses are numerous.

### (Section) [Concerning the Station of Stations, or the Manifest Imam]

Know that the Station of Stations (منزل المنازل) is an expression for the station that gathers all the stations that appear in the world of this life, from the Throne (العرش) to the dust, and it is called the Manifest Imam (الإمام المبين). Allah Almighty said: <<وَكُلَّ شَيْءٍ أَحْصَيْنَاهُ فِي إِمَامٍ مُبِينٍ>> (And all things We have enumerated in a Manifest Imam). So His saying, "We have enumerated it," is proof that He only deposited finite sciences within it. So we looked into whether their number could be confined by anyone, and they escaped confinement despite being finite, because it contains only what has existed from the day Allah created the world until the state of this life ends and the habitation transfers to the Hereafter. So we asked someone whom I trust among the scholars of Allah whether the fundamental sciences contained in this Manifest Imam are confined. He said: Yes. So the trustworthy, faithful, truthful companion informed me—and he made me promise not to mention his name—that the fundamental sciences, each of which encompasses an unquantifiable multiplicity, reach the number of one hundred twenty-nine thousand six hundred types of sciences. And every type contains vast sciences, which are expressed as stations. So I asked this trustworthy person: Has anyone among Allah’s creation attained them and encompassed them with knowledge? He said: No. Then he said: <<وَمَا يَعْلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَ>> (And none knows the hosts of your Lord except Him). And since the hosts are known only to Him, and the Real has no contender that these hosts would need to confront, he said to me: Do not wonder, <<فَوَرَبِّ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ>> (So by the Lord of the heaven and earth), there is indeed something more wondrous. I said: What is it? He said to me: That which Allah mentioned concerning two women among the wives of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. Then he recited: <<وَإِنْ تَظَاهَرَا عَلَيْهِ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ مَوْلَاهُ وَجِبْرِيلُ وَصَالِحُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمَلَائِكَةُ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ ظَهِيرٌ>> (And if you two [wives] cooperate against him, then indeed Allah is his Protector, and Gabriel, and the righteous among the believers, and the angels, moreover, are his supporters). So this is more wondrous than the mention of the hosts. For the secrets of Allah are wondrous. When he told me that, I asked Allah to inform me of the benefit of this matter and what this magnificence is, against which Allah placed Himself, Gabriel, the righteous believers, and the angels. So I was informed of it, and I was never delighted by anything as much as I was delighted by the knowledge of that. And I knew upon whom the two women relied and who strengthened them. And were it not for Allah mentioning Himself in the support, the angels and the believers would not have been able to resist them. And I knew that they had attained such knowledge of Allah and such influence in the world that granted them this power. And this is from the knowledge that is like the hidden treasure. So I thanked Allah for what He bestowed. I do not think that anyone among Allah’s creation relied upon what these two women relied upon. Lot, peace be upon him, says: <<لَوْ أَنَّ لِي بِكُمْ قُوَّةً أَوْ آوِي إِلَى رُكْنٍ شَدِيدٍ>> (If only I had strength against you or could take refuge in a strong support). And he had the strong support, but he did not know it. For the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, testified to that, saying: "May Allah have mercy on my brother Lot; he certainly took refuge in a strong support." And Aisha and Hafsa knew it. If people knew the knowledge upon which they stood, they would understand the meaning of this verse. And Allah speaks the Truth, and He guides to the way.
